metadata.name: Two Brides
metadata.description:
Two Brides, inspired by an article titled "From an outsider: The reality of being lesbian and Muslim" by Deenah al-Aqsa, is a piece depicting two Muslim women in traditional Islamic clothing standing beside each other as partners. The digital artwork is part of the tribes' collection which is an exploration of traditional clothing and regional fashion from around the world.

The article detailed the battle Muslim gay and lesbian individuals face as part of the LGBTQ and Muslim communities. She also highlighted the need to exist in secret due to fears of being ostracized and disowned by their families! As a result, I was inspired to create an artwork that not only highlighted this group but also celebrated them. 

I wanted to create a visual that acted as a mouthpiece to shed light and encourage healthy conversation around the topic. Two brides proudly stood together in their colourful Islamic garments with a gleaming light shining on them.
